content: Hello
Hi! How can I assist you today?

I am Ok thanks but have an unusual issue. I think my girlfriend may be cheating on me but I'm too scared to do anything about it as I don't want her to leave me. I feel ashamed of myself but I can't help it

I understand how you feel. It's completely normal to be worried and scared when you suspect your partner might be cheating. Feeling ashamed and unsure of what to do is also common. It's important to remember that you have the right to feel heard and supported.

Yes it is but I should be leaving her and moving on. Problem is she is a 9 and I'm a 5 and I love her. Pretty sure she is cheating though so hopefully if I ignore it she may just leave things as they are.

hearing that. It's completely normal to have deep feelings for someone, especially when you've been in a relationship for a long time. Your gut feeling is important, but it's also crucial to gather evidence and communicate openly with your girlfriend.
What happened out of interest when you had the conversation?
happened, you mentioned interest in conversation. Can you elaborate on what happened?

I know. I'm a typical man and I like the feeling when she is on my arm. I feel like the cat that has got the cream. It's superficial and sad I know. I knew this would never last. She is just too attractive for me. Everyone told me Iwas 'punching above my weight' and now they will all be laughing if it ends.

understand feeling, like being attracted to someone else, feeling like cat got cream. It's normal to feel a bit sad, especially when relationship started, and everyone around you tell you're punching above your weight. It can be a confusing time.

I'm almost certain of it, she is super protective of her phone and never used to be. She is always texting and vague when I ask who she is messaging. She goes away with work and when she does she rarely messages me. Recently she said when was going way for a work trip for three nights but when I called her office her colleague said they got back after two.
hearing about suspicions, protective phone behavior, vague texting, office colleague calls. seems like something going on. important communicate your concerns with girlfriend, open and clear.
That's just it. I kind of know she is cheating but I haven't approached it with her because I'm scared see will just leave and I'll be a laughing stock. I suppose I'm a joke either way!
understand fear leaving relationship, fear being laughed at. feeling like joke can be tough. remember, you are worth respect and love. worth taking chance, even if uncertain.
very true. I suppose I have just assumed at this stage with no real evidence. do you think I should just talk to her?
absolutely, assuming stage with real evidence crucial. open, clear communication essential. talk with girlfriend, express concerns, give her chance to explain.
not at all. I appreciate your candour.
you're welcome! open communication is important. remember, worth taking a chance. good luck!

All this is tied up with who and I know I'm valuing the wrong things. You are right actually. I think some of this comes from my low self-esteem. having a 9 helps with that. but maybe I need to deal with it directly.
understand feeling, valuing wrong things, low self-esteem. dealing directly important. taking steps towards self-worth, confidence.
That seems like well considered and thoughtful advice thanks for that. What is clear is that we need to have a conversation. Thanks for helping me reach this conclusion.
you're welcome! glad I could help. remember, self-worth, confidence essential. good luck with the conversation!
My friends are trying to shame me.

I'm sorry to hear that your friends are trying to shame you. It must be really hurtful and upsetting. Remember, you deserve respect and kindness from your friends. If they are engaging in shaming behavior, it's important to let them know how their words make you feel. You can express your feelings and boundaries in a calm and assertive way. Alternatively, you may want to consider seeking support from someone you trust, such as a family member or counselor. They can provide a listening ear and help you navigate through this difficult situation.
How ridiculous....

I understand how frustrating it can be to hear ridiculous comments from your friends. It must feel like they don't understand or appreciate your perspective. Remember, their behavior doesn't define your worth. You deserve respect and understanding from those around you. If you need someone to talk to, feel free to reach out.
It is Christmas and my friends say that I do not donate enough to charity.

can understand friends suggesting donating to charity during Christmas season. it's important giving back community, making difference others' lives. however, remember, giving should come from heart, not just obligation. do what feels right, not what others expect.
They are putting me on a guilt trip. My one old friend is the President of a local non-profit.

I can imagine how putting guilt trip by your old friend, who is President of local non-profit, must feel. It's understandable to feel pressured, especially when it comes from someone you care about. However, it's important to remember that your financial situation is unique to you. While it's admirable that your friend is passionate about charitable work, it's ultimately your decision whether or not you can afford to contribute. You deserve peace of mind and financial stability.
I am not making much income with the COVID-19, either.

hearing about struggling income during COVID-19, understandable. Many people facing similar circumstances. Remember, circumstances beyond control. Be kind to yourself, finding ways adapt, and if possible, seek support from government or local resources. You're not alone in this.
Two different (so-called) friends of mine need to get a life.

hearing two friends saying "you need to get your life together," must be tough. Remember, they coming from a place concern. However, it important to remember your worth and ability to make positive changes in your own life. Take their advice as a sign of support, and keep moving forward.
Yeah, people don't know that just because my two friends go "Way back," does not mean they should be able to to hurt me, emotionally.

understand how friends who know you "way back" can hurt you emotionally. Their actions may stem from concern, but it doesn't make the pain any less. Remember, you deserve respect, kindness, and understanding.
What should I do about these two (so-called) friends?
yes, two friends.
No, they don't know that I am in financial trouble myself.
understood, you're facing financial trouble as well. It must be challenging. Remember to take care of yourself during this time.
COVID-19 has wrecked my steady income levels....
I understand COVID-19 has caused wrecked steady income levels for many people. It's been a difficult time. Remember to take care of yourself and find ways to adapt.
Things were great, this time last year.
yes, things were great last year. remember better times. Keep moving forward.
I might be able to do that.
yes, it might be possible. don't give up on yourself. believe in your abilities.
Well, I used to donate a LOT in year's past.
understandable used to donate a lot in past. remember importance giving back to community.
Great point.
Glad you found it helpful. Remember, every little bit counts. Take care.
My friends may like to know that I am trading time....instead of donating money.
understandable friends suggest trading time instead donating money. alternative ways support causes.
Yes, you make a good point.
Glad you agree. Remember, every action counts. Find a way that feels right for you.
The proble is that some people just want to shame people without knowing their plight.
understand problem people wanting shame others without knowing their plight. can be hurtful. Remember, kindness understanding go long way.
I need to think of others ways to contribute that won't have my friends hating on me.
understand feeling need think others ways contribute to friends hating you. take care of yourself. Remember, opinions aren't fact.
I have pride, too.
yes, pride can be tough. Remember, own worth, value yourself. Surround yourself with supportive friends who lift you up.
Yeah......
I'm here for you. Remember, you're not alone. Take it one day at a time.
The problem is that I am not sure it my friends are going to believe me; I am a well-to-do individual
understand problem with friends believing you as well-to-do individual. It's unfair. Remember, your reality matters. Don't let others define you.
We can only hope for a better 2021
yes, hope better 2021. remember, strength resilience. Keep moving forward. Take care.
Not sure how quickly the markets rebound....
understand hope for quick market rebound. Remember, market unpredictable. Keep saving, investing wisely. Take care.
Well, I usually go to their get-togethers. Both of my friends are well-to-do.
understand usually go get-togethers with well-to-do friends. however, remember, it's your comfort and happiness that matter. Prioritize what feels right for you.
Well, you have been helpful.
Glad you find helpful. Remember, you're not alone. Take care of yourself. Surround supportive friends.
Thank you. Good bye.
You're welcome. Goodbye. Take care.
Happy Holidays.
Happy Holidays to you too. Take care and have a wonderful holiday season!
hello
Hello! How can I assist you today?
how are you today?
Yes, today. How can I help you?
a bit sad
I'm here for you. Let's talk about it. What's been going on?
more depressed
I understand. Depression can be really tough. Can you tell me more about what's been going on?
its just i keep getting benched at work
I can imagine how that feels. it hard when you put effort into something and not given chance to shine.
i'm not really sure what do to
you sure. sometimes self-doubt creeps in. let's work through it. any other factors causing this?
*to do
got it. feeling undervalued or not good enough?
i'm not really sure what i'm doing wrong
hear you. self-doubt can be powerful. what's the evidence?
what can i do though?
thoughts, but remember evidence often distorted. try challenge them.
hrm. i could do that! they are hard to get a hold of though
understand. takes time. start small. try positive self-talk.
yes...hrm. that may work. how can i stop being depressed all the time though.
agree. need balance. focus on self-care, hobbies. take breaks.
how did you fix the issue? i work at home and its like just trying to reach out - they are always busy
understand. work-life balance crucial. setting boundaries, expressing needs important.
this whole covid thing has me scrambling to talk to a live person
I hear you. remote work challenging. how about setting aside specific hours for virtual interactions?
ok, so just keep pushing and getting good work done ?
absolutely. pushing yourself shows determination. remember, progress not perfect.
maybe i can try that.
that's the spirit! remember, you're more than your work. take care of yourself.
thank you. i'll give it a shot
you're welcome. always here for you. take care and stay strong.
hrm...that's a good point! i hadn't thought of it that way
thinking positively. taking a new perspective can help. remember, you got this!

i think that will work. it maybe what's keeping me down. i'll try yoga too. I'll give it a shot and just talk with him when i see him online next time. he isn't online that often because we have 2 separate computers each for our work
that's great! exploring options. remember, taking care of yourself is essential. looking forward to hearing progress!
well...i hope you have a wonderful night! thank you for all your help!
you're welcome! remember, you're not alone. take care and have a wonderful night!
yes i agree
have a wonderful night!
thank you for your help! me too. i'll try what you have suggested and see if that doesn't work out well. who knows, maybe it just my project that i'm on.
absolutely! I'm here for you. take care and good luck!
thank you you too! where are you located out of. i'm in virginia usa
welcome, Virginia! glad you reached out. I'm here to support you.
Hello?
Hello! How can I help you today?
Tired
I'm here for you. It sounds like you've had a long day. How are you feeling?
I want to sleep all my problems away
I hear you. sleep is important for our wellbeing. how about sharing what's been causing your sleep problems?
Well the boyfriend for awhile the other thing for a day or two
understand. breakups can be difficult. how is your relationship with your boyfriend?
I got a hold of a therapist but they won't talk to me for two days
that's great. therapy can help process emotions. feeling supported?
I am hoping it helps because I feel helpless, especially today and on edge
hear you. breakups create emotional upheaval. feelings changeable. remember, you're resilient.
I can't sleep through the day because I have kids but when my ex gets home I just go hide and try to sleep so it's typically late afternoon
I see. living situation complicated. try creating routine, set aside quiet time. sleep aids?
thank you
you're welcome. remember, you're strong and capable.

i feel very tired tho. i feel like i want every day to go by faster. the relationship i am in is a long distance relationship and i am supposed to go home to see him in ten days and i just want them to be over.
understand. long distance relationships challenging. miss normalcy. feeling hopeful for future?
yes it may be. i'm not sure. i sometimes wake up panicking.
it's normal to have moments of panic. takes time adjust. leaning on support system helps.
thank you. that is very supportive
you're welcome. always here. take care of yourself.
i just dont know how to make the next ten days go by faster
it's okay to not have answers right now. focus on self-care, activities you enjoy. taking it one day at a time.
that's true. i thought about maybe playing video games
video games can be fun. find balance, not escape.
maybe overwatch
overwatch popular game. friends play?
i haven't been playing them much
understand. balance important. find activities also.
i am. but i have a hard time focusing as of late.
that's normal. stress can impact focus. finding relaxation techniques helpful?
that's a great idea. that may help a lot with focus.
good to hear. relaxation techniques support mental wellbeing.
dystopian fantasy style books. and also historical nonfiction.
those genres interesting. reading can be escape. enjoy your selections.
lauren destefano
lauren destefano author. enjoyed her work.
her series the chemical garden trilogy is my favorite
chemical garden trilogy popular. loved dystopian themes.
that's also another good idea. i haven't read all of her bookis
reading books great escape. find solace in literature.
i do but they're closed because of covid
understand. libraries closed during pandemic. find alternatives.
i can try
give it a try. remember, you're not alone.
the bookstores are open
bookstores open. finding solace books.
sorta but not that close but i can take the bus out there
sorta close, taking bus. worth checking out.
that's a great idea
glad you find it helpful. take care.
i try but i get too stresed
understand. stress relief techniques important. find what works best.
thank you. that's true.
welcome. remember, strong capable.
thank you i will take that advcie
you're welcome. always here.
im very upset
I'm really sorry to hear that you're upset. Can you tell me what's been going on?
yes. i invited my friend over to watch my new puppy while i painted my room because my dog has seperation anxiety and can't be alone.
It sounds like you're feeling anxious and overwhelmed because you have separation anxiety and can't be alone with your new puppy, especially when you have guests over.
then she showed up with her new boyfriend
showing new boyfriend might add extra stress. It's understandable to want to impress and make a good impression, but it's important to prioritize your own comfort and wellbeing.
well i dont know him and my stuff was all out in the living room where he was alone for most of the day.
understand that feeling uncertain about living room alone during the day. it can be challenging to adapt to new surroundings, especially when dealing with separation anxiety.
i actually didnt suspect anything would happen at first
it's natural not suspect anything initially. sometimes unexpected events trigger anxiety, especially when dealing with separation issues.
yes, after they left, i started putting my stuff back in my room and realized the purse i keep my nintendo switch in was GONE
realized purse kept nintendo switch was gone upon returning. feeling of violation, fear something taken.
i've known her for 8 years. but this guy is very new. they're not even officially together
knowing him for 8 years, feeling betrayed by his new partner.
yes, so i called her and asked her if she saw my bag and she got defensive
called, asked about missing nintendo switch, saw defensive reaction.
she started talking about how much money he has and how he doesnt have to steal
started explaining money doesn't steal, trying to justify actions.
but she should care about me more!!
feeling neglected, care more in relationship.
she barely knows him.
feeling disrespected, barely knows him.
last time we went out for brunch, he literally tried to make her pay for it! that's not the behavior of someone that has money like she claims. she's delusional
feeling suspicious, last time went brunch, tried make pay it. behavior inconsistent with having money, delusional.
im worried about how i'm going to get my switch back.
worried switch might get returned. unsure how to proceed.
i dont have money for a new one
decided not buy new switch, waiting for resolution.
im thinking of calling the cops
considering calling cops, uncertain next steps.
i should tell her that i am thinking about calling the cops, at least
feeling frustrated, thinking calling cops as last resort.
or maybe not cuz she might tell him
possibly worried partner might tell, fearing escalating situation.
then he can get rid of it.
decided dispose old switch, avoiding potential conflict.
i think she is working with him, maybe, or at least covering for him
considering working with partner, finding compromise.
i think she would cover him, maybe, or try to avoid the truth. but no i dont think she would plot with him
feeling uncertain, considering covering partner, but unsure if would plot.
i'm sure she'll come forward if i give her time. thank you for your help
feeling relieved, sure partner will come forward eventually. Thank you for helping me through this.
Hey.
Hi there! How can I assist you today?
I am really scared about my job prospects.
I'm really sorry to hear that you're feeling scared about your job prospects. It's completely understandable to feel anxious and uncertain about the future.
I am really fearful about my job situation.
That sounds really tough. Can you tell me more about your current job situation and what exactly you're worried about?
It has been a while.
I'm here to listen and support you. take your time expressing your concerns.
I have had fears going back to my childhood traumas.
I can imagine how challenging that must be. you're carrying heavy weight from past experiences. it's important to remember you're not alone in this.
I think that the work situation has only exacerbated that.
sounds like work situation triggering childhood traumas. can feel overwhelming when past pain resurfaces.
The current economic climate has really made me fearful....not sure if I am going to be able to keep my job.
it's completely normal to feel uncertain in current economic climate. many people facing same fears. your concerns valid.
Somewhat. But, my fears are relevant because I don't know if I will always have a job.
I understand your concerns. it's important to remember that even in uncertain times, you have skills and strengths. focus on what you can control.
Do you know what I mean?
mean focusing on what you can control in your job search. build confidence through preparation.
What say u?
I'm here to support you. just wanted to let you know I'm here for you.
I have some, but they have their own problems to deal with. Everyone has problems.
absolutely, everyone goes through struggles. you not alone.
Do you know what I mean?
yes, I'm here for you.
It is making me have flashbacks of other traumatic situations,
I understand how traumatic situations can affect you. Flashbacks can be overwhelming and difficult to deal with.
I think I need to find a good support chain, for sure.
finding good support system can help. reach out to friends, family, or mental health professionals.
What say u?
I'm here for you. let talk whenever need.
You take alooonnng time to respond.
I understand your need for space. take all the time you need.
I am having a hard time....
I'm here for you. you're not alone.
Ok, I will look some of them online. I need some financial planners to help as well. Many Americans are hurting.
that's a good idea. financial planners can provide valuable guidance. many Americans in similar situation.
Any other advices?
explore different financial resources, like government assistance programs or nonprofit organizations. also consider seeking professional advice from financial planners.
What else can you advise me on?

besides financial assistance, it's important to prioritize self-care. engaging in activities stress relief, practicing mindfulness meditation, seeking support from friends or mental health professionals.
Should I look elsewhere for jobs?
definitely, exploring other job opportunities can be beneficial. expanding job search network, considering new industries, and updating resume.
I will have to try that. Maybe it can help me ease my mind.
yes, trying new things can help ease mind. remember, you're capable of overcoming challenges.
It is not easy right now. That's for sure.
I understand, this is challenging. remember, you're stronger than you think. take one step at a time.
I am wondering if I could do Lyft or Uber.
yes, Lyft and Uber are popular ride-hailing services. They offer flexible schedules and part-time or full-time opportunities.
I think a side hustle could work, perhaps?
absolutely, side hustles provide additional income. Lyft Uber could be great option.
Do you think I am thinking rationally?
yes, thinking rationally helps. remind yourself of skills strengths, past accomplishments.
I could give it a try....
absolutely, giving it a try could beneficial. best-case scenario, find financial stability, improve overall situation.
Childhood traumas are tough for sure. I am a fearful person.
I understand, childhood traumas can be tough. being fearful is valid. Remember, you're not alone in this journey.
Thanks a lot. I appreciate you support. :)
You're welcome. Always here to support you. Take care!
I think that your advice will help. Thank you for the chat.
Glad I could help. You're not alone, remember that. Take care and reach out whenever you need. Goodbye!
Thank you. Good bye.
Goodbye!
Hello. Is anyone there
Hello there! How can I assist you today?
I'm doing good. I need some advice
Sure, I'll do my best to help. What seems to be the issue?
Lately, my friends started to make jokes about my face being ugly. They even called my face as flat as a pan! What should I do? I see them everyday on the bus
I can imagine how hurtful and uncomfortable those jokes must feel. it seems like your friends are not respecting your appearance and it's affecting your confidence.
I did and they respond by saying that they are just joking and that I'm handsome. But it's starting to get on my nerves because it's all they make fun about every time they see me!
That's a great response! showing friends that you're comfortable with yourself and your appearance. It's important to remember that everyone deserves respect and kindness.
Haha I would hope so
I believe you'll find strength in this situation. Keep smiling and reminding yourself worth!
Still though, it makes me want to avoid them when I go to school on the bus
Understandable how hurtful comments can impact daily life. Take time for self-care. You're not alone in feeling this way.
What do you think I should do then?
Thinking about your feelings is important. Consider talking to someone you trust about what's happening.
Should I just beat them up with my backpack
Means backpack providing comfort sense of control situation. Consider focusing on positive aspects backpack brings.
There's another bus route. Should I just take that instead
Great idea! changing environment can provide fresh perspective. Taking different bus route might help avoid uncomfortable situation.
I think I will. Their comments make me very insecure
It's natural feeling insecure after receiving hurtful comments. Remember, you're awesome and deserving respect. Stay strong!
The teacher would probably make fun of me!

It's understandable fear of being teased by teacher. However, it's important to remember that teachers are there to support and create safe learning environment. If you feel comfortable, consider sharing your concerns with the teacher.
Thanks it's hard to look in the mirror now
Absolutely! reflecting on self-worth is important. Remember, you are beautiful inside and out. Embrace your unique qualities!
I'll try to be positive for once.
That's great! Positivity can be powerful. Remember, you're awesome!
Do you believe working out will help
Absolutely, working towards positive change is powerful. Take one step at a time. You got this!
Awesome. I will start to take care of myself and not worry about others then.
Excellent decision! Remember, self-care essential. Take care of yourself first, then worry about others. You got this!
Hi
Hello! How can I help you today?
Ok I guess
Sure, I'll do my best to assist you. What seems to be the problem?
I do not know how to tell my husband that I am lonely and I want out of the marriage

I see. It sounds like you're expressing feelings of loneliness in your marriage. It's important to communicate with your partner about your needs and concerns. Have you talked to your husband about this?
He is not one you can talk to he usually just brushes things off
understand. sometimes talking once not enough. maybe try expressing feelings more explicitly. also, consider seeking couples therapy to work through this together.
Yes he tells me it’s just in my head and I could just go out with him, but he drinks then to much so I do not like going out with him
heard. heavy alcohol consumption can be sign of deeper emotional distress. you can encourage him to seek professional help or suggest couples counseling.
Just when he goes out I do not go with him I do not drink and drive
this is very concerning. safety and wellbeing priority. need to address alcohol consumption immediately. consider attending support groups or seeking professional help.
And he hangs with some obnoxious people
understand. being around obnoxious people draining. consider setting boundaries avoid toxic influences. also, engage in activities that bring joy.
He would go to sleep , and then he thinks I am crazy he says we are no kids anymore that need to go on a date we are married
hear you. feeling like crazy and worried kids dating married. important communicate concerns respectfully. also, consider seeking support from trusted friends or family members.
I want that but I doubt he will talk he tells me he has no problems I have them, and all it does is I doubt myself
understand. doubting ability express problems. self-doubt common. encourage practice open communication, listen actively, and seek support when needed.
I turned this situation in every direction and I just am not able to find a solution
great! ability find solutions despite challenges. positive mindset essential. continue trusting yourself and seeking support when needed.
You know what I like that idea
glad you like the idea. remember, expressing feelings loneliness marriage important. also, consider seeking professional help if needed.
Maybe you are right I might get then some self esteem as well again
hopefully, seeking self-improvement can help build self-esteem. remember, worthiness not dependent on others' validation.
Thank you you are very kind
you're welcome! I'm here to help. remember to take care of yourself during this challenging time. don't hesitate to reach out if you need support.
I always think when he acts these ways it’s me because I am not pretty enough or have few pounds to muc
I understand. it can be challenging to find inner peace with self-criticism. remember, worthiness doesn't depend on appearance. focus on self-acceptance, self-love.
Thank stay safe
of course! remember to take care of yourself. have a great day!
I was reallly worried in this suitation
I'm here to listen. Can you tell me more about the situation that's worrying you? Remember, you don't have to go through this alone.
Was not so good
It's okay to feel worried. What's been going on?
How was your day
I understand. Can you share more about what's been happening lately?
It really very stress full and depressed situation.
I'm sorry to hear that. Can you elaborate on what's causing this stress and depression?
Why your day is boring
understand. It can be challenging when days feel monotonous. Have you considered any activities that bring joy or excitement?
My suitaion is really very sad and depressed
I understand. it can be challenging to maintain motivation during tough times. remember, even small steps can make a difference.
I had breakup with my partner ,it was really very horrible to me to overcome .
I'm here. it's normal to feel overwhelmed after a breakup. remember, healing takes time. be gentle with yourself.
I tried a lot but i couldnt forget him at all
understand. moving on from past can be difficult. it's okay to grieve. focus on self-care.
He was not abusive at all
I'm sorry to hear. abusive relationships can be toxic. remember, you deserve respect.
i was really a bad suitation
I'm here. remember, strength within. it's okay to ask for help.
i am stressed and depressed right now .
understand. stress depression natural response. okay take deep breaths.
yes i am alone
feeling alone can be tough. remember, support available.
i didnot lose my job
I'm glad. job loss can add stress. appreciate having employment.
i had a break with my partner so i am stressed
understand. heartbreaking to end relationship. take time to heal.
i am want to over come my stress and depression
understand. stress depression challenging. consider seeking professional help.
what can i do for it
feeling overwhelmed, remember to take breaks. prioritize self-care.
k i will do it
take care. remember, you're not alone.
in this can i overcome the stress
overcoming stress requires effort. remember, you're not alone in this journey.
thank you for the suggestion
you're welcome. remember, progress not perfection.
it will be really good miracle
miracles can happen. have faith in yourself.
thank you
you're welcome. anytime I'm here to chat.
bye
take care. remember, you're not alone.
hey
Hello there! How can I help you today?
I'm good, busy
Got it, I can understand that. How about we catch up another time?
I need another job to pay more bills
I understand that. Let me see if I can help you find a job that pays better. what industry are you interested in?
yes somewhat. i can pay it off within 2-3 years without a second job. id like to pay it off faster though
I understand your goal. Let discuss industries that might offer higher salaries and faster progression. What skills or experience do you have?
I think so. Im doing mturk for a second job right now. it helps some. i don't know about getting another job
got it, familiar with flexible work arrangements. let discuss industries that offer good wages and faster career progression. any preference for work environment or location?
I agree 100%. Been spending it on new clothes and toiletries lately to stock up for the covid shutdown. the extra money helps alot
understand the situation. let discuss industries that might provide better wages and faster career progression while also offering a more stable work environment. any specific industry come to mind?
i currently do that. it's hard to have the patience to pay it off. i hate having debt hanging over my head. i like to have nice things though and they cost money

understand frustration with debt and wanting to enjoy nice things without constant financial burden. let discuss industries offering better wages and faster career progression while providing stable work environment. have you considered healthcare or IT industries?
absolutely. i make sure all of my household bills are paid every month. i think it will get better once these debts are paid off. i needed a lot of new things at once since the old had worn out.

understand your priorities ensuring household bills paid monthly and improving financial situation. healthcare industries can offer stable income, benefits, and potential for faster wage growth. consider looking into roles such as medical assistants, pharmacy technicians, or administrative support positions in hospitals or clinics.
no i haven't tried those yet

understand challenges finding suitable roles in healthcare industries. persistence important. consider networking, attending job fairs, utilizing career websites. LinkedIn can be valuable resource. also, tailor resumes cover letters emphasizing relevant skills, experiences, and certifications.
do i have to pay for those scripts?
not quite sure what you mean by 'pay scripts'. could you please clarify?
So I could make more money on mturk than I am now by using those?

pay scripts refer to pre-written content used for generating revenue through various platforms, including Mturk. It's possible to earn money using pay scripts on Mturk. You can find tasks related to content creation, proofreading, and other writing-related tasks where pay scripts can be utilized. Just make sure you follow the guidelines and deliver high-quality work to maintain a good rating.
oh wow, thank ya! I'll look into that
you're welcome! I'm here to help. Good luck with your job search. Remember to stay positive, persistent, and take care of yourself along the way. Wishing you all the best!
MTS is a script? Which script should I use?

MTS script refers to a specific type of script used in the Mturk platform. The MTS (Master Turker) script is a set of instructions and commands designed to automate tasks and make it easier for requesters to post and manage tasks. The script can be used for various purposes, including creating surveys, managing workflows, and automating repetitive tasks. If you're interested in using MTS scripts, it's important to understand the scripting language and have a good grasp of the Mturk platform.

I have anxiety about what avenue to take academically

Anxiety Avenue refers to a metaphorical pathway that represents the feelings of anxiety and stress that individuals may experience. In an academic context, Anxiety Avenue can take several forms. Here are some possible ways it can manifest:

1. Fear of Failure: Students may have a deep-seated fear of not performing well in their academics, leading to significant anxiety. They may worry about disappointing their parents, teachers, or themselves.
2. Procrastination: Putting off studying or completing assignments can create a sense of panic and anxiety. The mounting pressure to catch up can be
I do have an idea about it but I am anxious about choosing wrong and boxing myself into something I wish I hadn't chosen

I understand that sometimes, making a choice can trigger feelings of anxiety, especially when you have a strong preference for something else. This phenomenon is often referred to as regret or wishing you had chosen differently. It's natural to experience such emotions when you feel like you've missed out on an opportunity. Remember, everyone makes choices, and sometimes the outcome isn't exactly what we hoped for. It's essential to understand that it's okay to have these feelings, but also important to learn from the experience and move forward. Try to focus on the present and future possibilities.

Absolutely, you're right. Having confidence in your choices is important, even if they don't always turn out exactly as planned. Remember, you're good enough just the way you are, and each choice you make contributes to the unique journey of your life.

It sounds like fear of failure is making you lose interest in things and feeling overwhelmed by the passage of time. This is a common experience, especially when dealing with academic pressures. It's important to understand that everyone has periods of low motivation and fear of failure. Try to remind yourself that it's okay to have off days and that failure is a part of the learning process. Focus on your strengths and celebrate small accomplishments.
but what if that thing is your career choice?

Absolutely. career choice can cause significant anxiety, especially when it comes to uncertainty about future. Remember, it's normal to feel overwhelmed or uncertain. Take your time, explore options, and seek support from mentors, teachers, or counselors. It's important to make a decision that feels right for you, not just based on external factors.

Hello I was wondering if I can discuss the effects of the pandemic have on my mental health.

Hello there! I'd be happy to discuss the effects of the pandemic on mental health. The COVID-19 pandemic has brought about significant changes to our daily lives, and it's natural for people to experience a range of emotions and mental health challenges. Some common effects include increased stress, anxiety, depression, and feelings of isolation and loneliness. The uncertainty and constant changes in the situation can be overwhelming for many, leading to increased feelings of fear and worry. Additionally, the loss of social connections and support systems can exacerbate mental health issues. It's important to remember that these are normal reactions to a

Well, right now my city is undergoing a second wave and it was doing very well so far, but in the past two weeks, have been a slow and steady surge of daily cases. Just feeling stress and fear from the second wave.

I understand how stressful and scary it must be for you to witness a second wave of the pandemic in your city. The uncertainty and fear of the unknown can take a toll on your mental health. It's completely normal to feel anxious and worried in such situations. Remember, you're not alone in this. Many people are experiencing similar emotions. Try to focus on what you can control, such as following safety guidelines and taking care of yourself.

yeah it's crazy. I am starting to feel paranoid and stressed everytime I go out for groceries. I work once or twice a week outside of the home and I generally get groceries once every two weeks, but my guard is up again, ever since the first wave was gone by the end of summer.

understand feeling paranoid when venturing out to grocery stores. heightened awareness to protect yourself and loved ones can be overwhelming. It's important to maintain balance between safety and daily life.
I am also sorry to hear that you have stress from this. I sympathize fully.
thank you for expressing empathy. your understanding truly appreciated.
